snippet: The newly anointed successor to Jon Stewart on “The Daily Show” has a fearlessness when it comes to talking about race from his life in South Africa.
abstract: Profile of Trevor Noah, South African comic who has been chosen to succeed Jon Stewart as the host of The Daily Show; Noah's comedic sensibility, known for its fearlessness, has been shaped by his mixed-race background and his home country's apartheid legacy.

byline.original: By NORIMITSU ONISHI and DAVE ITZKOFF
byline.contributor: Norimitsu Onishi reported from Johannesburg, and Dave Itzkoff from New York.

lead_paragraph: The newly anointed successor to Jon Stewart on “The Daily Show” has a fearlessness when it comes to talking about race from his life in South Africa.

headline.main: Trevor Noah Sees Childhood Under Apartheid as License to Speak His Mind
headline.print_headline: Stewart’s Heir, Laughing in Apartheid’s Shadow
